item.title: Overscoping and eval
item.description: In my previous post I used the lm function for an example of scope rules, but I left a few details out. I didn’t want to muddy the example with too many details, so I choice to lie a little. The drawing I used to explain the example was this: I explained how scope is implemented using environments that are chained through parent pointers, and how a function has an environment associated with it. This environment is the environment where you define the function. When you call a function, it gets its own instance environment (for historical reasons more than anything else we call this the call frame, but it is really just a new environment).
